endorsements.name: Sorel Reisman
endorsements.title: Emeritus Professor, Cal State Fullerton
endorsements.organization: IEEE Computer Society President Emeritus
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc brings an incredible journey supporting IEEE computer society and its many services. I have observed him in IEEE functions and was always impressed with his dedication to promote IEEE, bring efficiencies and work hard to make it a very successful solid organization. He brings together research, teaching and service, but above all leadership, which is what make a big difference for a president. I fully support his nomination and I am confident he will make a very successful IEEE president.

endorsements.location: University of Texas at Austin, TX
endorsements.name: Yale Patt
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: University of Texas at Austin; Ernest Cockrell, Jr. Centennial Chair in Engineering; ACM-IEEE CS Eckert-Mauchly Award Winner
endorsements.quote: In my view there are several necessary conditions for being an outstanding Division Director. The candidate must be knowledgeable on IEEE issues, and deep understanding of the mechanisms available within IEEE to deal with them. Jean-Luc has served in many key positions in IEEE for many years, including President of the Computer Society, which makes him exceptionally knowledgeable where it counts. The candidate must be genuinely fair minded. Anyone who knows Jean-Luc knows he gets high marks on this. Finally, the candidate must enjoy performing the service that being a Division Director will entail. Jean-Luc has demonstrated that commitment to service in every IEEE role he has assumed. Bottom line: It is a pleasure to endorse his candidacy for Division Director with no reservations whatsoever. In my view, IEEE would be lucky to have Jean-Luc in that role.

endorsements.name: Wen-Mei Hwu
endorsements.title: AMD Jerry Sanders Chair of Electrical and Computer Engineering
endorsements.organization: University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign; ACM-IEEE CS Eckert-Mauchly Award Winner
endorsements.quote: It is my great pleasure to endorse Prof. Jean-Luc Gaudiot for IEEE Computer Society Division Director. I have interacted with Jean-Luc for more than 35 years. Jean-Luc is an accomplished scholar and a well-recognized leader. I worked with Jean-Luc on the IEEE Computer Architecture Letters editorial board as well as many other committees. Jean-Luc has always served our community with the highest level of energy, thoughtfulness, and integrity. His service to the community as the IEEE Computer Society President was exemplary! I am very glad to learn that Jean-Luc is willing to serve as the president of the Computer Society Division Director. I am confident that if elected, he would once again bring great value to the position and provide excellent leadership to the Society.

endorsements.location: IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY
endorsements.name: Valentina Salapura
endorsements.title: Manager, Watson Health Cloud
endorsements.organization: IBM Academy of Technology; IBM Master Inventor; IBM T.J. Watson Research Center
endorsements.quote: It is a great pleasure to support Prof. Gaudiot as candidate for IEEE Computer Society Division V Director. Prof. Gaudiot is a distinguished researcher, educator and visionary in the field of computer systems. Long before the current interest in parallel systems, Prof. Gaudiot helped create some of the very fora that researchers and practitioners rely on today to exploit parallel systems as a cofounder and steering committee chair of the PACT conference. Dr. Gaudiot has demonstrated his visionary leadership and passion by founding IEEE Computer Architecture Letters. Through his thoughtful leadership and commitment to service, Dr. Gaudiot has been deeply engaged in nearly every aspect of the Computer Society, including awards selection, editorial leadership for publications, and as program committee and general chair of many major IEEE conferences. I am convinced that this combination of visionary leadership and organizational skills will make Prof. Jean-Luc Gaudiot an outstanding Division Director to represent the IEEE Computer Society.

endorsements.location: IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY
endorsements.name: Jose E. Moreira
endorsements.title: Distinguished Research Staff Member
endorsements.organization: IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center; IEEE Fellow
endorsements.quote: I have known Jean-Luc for over 30 years since we met at a research workshop in Brazil. Jean-Luc is someone who has made profound contributions to our field of research and to our community. His research interests span a broad spectrum including parallel processing and computer architecture, which I am most familiar with. He is one of the most distinguished researchers in our community with hundreds of publications and over thirty Ph.D. students graduated. He has also organized multiple conferences and served as editor of various journals. I am most grateful for him helping me and some colleagues to improve the quality and reach of SBAC-PAD, a computer architecture conference that started as a Brazilian event and is now an IEEE international conference. We seldom see a person that can make as much impact to industry, academia, and the community in general as Jean-Luc. I should also note that Jean-Luc had a very successful tenure as president of the IEEE Computer Society, and it would be to our great benefit if he were to serve in the capacity of IEEE Computer Society Division Director.

endorsements.location: University of California, San Diego, CA
endorsements.name: Roger U. Fujii
endorsements.title: FIEEE
endorsements.organization: IEEE Computer Society President Emeritus; IEEE Past Vice President for Technical Activities
endorsements.quote: The duties of the Computer Society Division Director are first to represent the Computer Society on all agenda items before the IEEE Board of Directors including any impact that a topic/motion could have on Computer Society activities/finance. Secondly, when voting on any agenda item, the Division Director should vote in the best interest of IEEE even when consequences to the Computer Society is not optimal. As Computer Society President, Jean-Luc made impactful cost cutting decisions. He supported the financial transparency initiative which reduced the IEEE indirect charges to the Computer Society. These challenging and difficult decisions combined with cost reduction decisions of prior Computer Presidents brought the Computer Society back to a positive financial status. A Division Director must not be influenced by regional or special interest groups but always consider what best for IEEE. These are the values that I see in Jean-Luc and thus my endorsement for him as the Computer Society Division Director position.

endorsements.location: University of Southern California, Los Angeles, CA
endorsements.name: Viktor Prasanna
endorsements.title: Charles Lee Powell Chair in Engineering
endorsements.organization: Ming Hsieh Department of Electrical Engineering, USC
endorsements.quote: I have had the unique privilege of interacting with Jean-Luc for over thirty years, first as a highly regarded colleague at USC, as a respected member of the broader research community and as a IEEE Computer Society volunteer in many roles. I am impressed with his vision, his commitment to the leadership roles and creating value for the communities he served. He successfully led the society as its president in 2016, culminating in a better financial situation, new products and services and improved links with India. I think he will be an excellent choice for the Division V Director. He has my most enthusiastic endorsement.

endorsements.name: David Alan Grier
endorsements.title: Co-Principal
endorsements.organization: Djaghe LLC; Past President IEEE Computer Society
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc is a skilled and highly effective in the IEEE. He is good advocate of this positions, knows how to work with people and how to stand against ideas that are not good. He'll be a very good Division Director.

endorsements.name: Dwight Streit
endorsements.title: UCLA Engineering Professor Emeritus
endorsements.organization: Former VP and Technical Fellow at Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems and TRW Space & Electronics; NAE, IEEE and AAAS Fellow; NASA Space Foundation Technology Hall of Fame
endorsements.quote: I have known and worked with Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot for over 25 years and he has my strong endorsement for IEEE Computer Society Division V Director. He has been an outstanding leader in the IEEE Computer Society for decades and will be highly effective as Division V Director.

endorsements.name: Dejan Milojicic
endorsements.title: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Fellow and VP
endorsements.organization: 2014 IEEE CS President
endorsements.quote: I have known Jean-Luc for more than 15 years. We were both active in IEEE Computer Society leadership, including both serving as IEEE CS Presidents. Jean Luc also held other VP positions and contributed in many ways to IEEE CS growth and serving membership. Jean Luc has all the qualities required for being Division Director and he would bring a lot of value to Society and its members

endorsements.location: Colorado State University, Fort Collins, CO
endorsements.name: H. J. Siegel
endorsements.title: IEEE Fellow; Abell Endowed Chair Distinguished Professor
endorsements.organization: Colorado State University; Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering and Computer Science
endorsements.quote: I have known Dr. Jean-Luc Gaudiot for over 30 years, and I consider his leadership in professional service extraordinary. He has been a leader in the IEEE Computer Society throughout his career: President, VP publications, VP Educational Activities Board, member of Board of Governors, Chair of the Technical Committee on Computer Architecture (TCCA), Chair of the Transactions Operations Committee and Magazine Operations Committee, a member of numerous conference organizing committees, Chair and Co-Chair of many conference program committees, and guest editor, editorial board member, and Editor-in-Chief for many prestigious journals. I have worked with Jean-Luc on many of these professional activities, including serving on the Publications Board, and he is an effective, inspiring leader who rallies his team and works with them to achieve significant results. I wish to add that Jean-Luc is respected by his colleagues as "a gentleman and a scholar." I fully and strongly endorse Jean-Luc for IEEE Division V Director, based on his goals for this position listed on his webpage, his extensive experience, proven abilities, and dedication to success.

endorsements.location: University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
endorsements.name: Mazin Yousif
endorsements.title: Managing Director
endorsements.organization: Quantum Research Institute at the University of Michigan
endorsements.quote: I have observed Jean-Luc at numerous IEEE functions and have always been impressed by his dedication to promoting the organization, his efforts to enhance its efficiency, and his hard work in making it a strong, successful entity. He seamlessly integrates research, teaching, and service, but it is his exceptional leadership that sets him apart. This quality is crucial for a Division Director. I fully support his nomination and am confident that he will make an outstanding IEEE Division Director.

endorsements.name: Ron Perrott
endorsements.title: Director
endorsements.organization: Oxford e-Research Centre, University of Oxford
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc Gaudiot has the research background, the experience, the commitment, the enthusiasm, and the track record of service involvement and achievement to the Computer Society to enable him to fulfill the role and expanded the activities of an IEEE Computer Society Division Director. I base this opinion on having known and worked with him over a period of thirty years. He has made substantial contributions to the community through his work as Vice President of the Computer Society in a wide range of activities, in particular, education, publications, conference chairs, awards committee etc. as well as serving on the Board of Governors. This was followed by a highly successful year as President where among other things he placed the Society on a more secure financial footing and encouraged colleagues to look beyond their technical "silos" by becoming members in multiple societies. He has therefore a solid track record of achievements and direct experience of the activities and requirements of the IEEE Computer Society to fulfil the role of Division Director.

endorsements.name: Apostolos Dollas
endorsements.title: Professor and Dean of EC
endorsements.organization: Technical University of Crete, Greece
endorsements.quote: It is a pleasure to wholeheartedly support Prof. Jean-Luc Gaudiot for IEEE Computer Society Division Director. I have been very familiar with his excellent research for many decades. In more recent times I had the opportunity to meet him and exchange views regarding many issues in the field. I share his vision regarding the IEEE Computer Society, especially regarding the Society's international presence and outreach. At the same time I am confident that his stellar record in demanding administration posts, combined with his academic excellence and ties with industry will lead to a very successful term.

endorsements.name: Eui-Young Chung
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Yonsei University, Seoul, Korea
endorsements.quote: It was a great opportunity to work with Dr. Gaudiot in 2012 as a visiting scholar at his research group, UC Irvine. I learned many things from him in many aspects - research, management, education, collaboration, and service for the society. Beyond his achievements, I was impressed by his personality. He is an open-minded, thoughtful, altruistic, and responsible leader.

endorsements.name: Sungroh Yoon
endorsements.title: Ph.D., Professor
endorsements.organization: Electrical and Computer Engineering & Artificial Intelligence, Seoul National University; 2013 IEEE/IEIE Joint Award Recipient for Young IT Engineers
endorsements.quote: I am honored to strongly endorse Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot for the position of Division Director of the IEEE Computer Society. As a professor in the field of Electrical and Computer Engineering with over 17 years of experience in research, teaching, and industry collaboration, I have often looked to the footsteps of senior researchers to guide my own development. Among those I have regarded as role models, Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot stands out prominently. Whenever I sought assistance, Professor Gaudiot consistently provided the best help he could offer, becoming a significant source of support and inspiration. His previous tenure as President of the IEEE Computer Society in 2017 left a profound impact on me, showcasing his exceptional leadership and forward-looking vision. Professor Gaudiot's contributions and dedication to the IEEE Computer Society are exemplary. It is with great conviction that I endorse Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot for the position of Division Director of the IEEE Computer Society, confident that his leadership will continue to bring about positive advancements for the organization.

endorsements.name: Avi Mendelson
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: EE and CS departments, Technion, Israel
endorsements.quote: Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot, a distinguished leader in the Computer Society, has made significant contributions over the years. Our strong professional connection, which dates back to our debates on data flow vs. Von-Neumann architectures, has given me a deep insight into his capabilities and dedication. Having grown up in Europe (France) and spent most of his professional life in the USA, he has become a renowned researcher. His exceptional dedication to the Computer Society is evident in the numerous roles he has served and the contributions he has made. His active involvement in areas such as hardware security, HPC, data-flow architectures, and Architectures for LLMs further underscores his commitment. It is with great pleasure that I endorse Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot for the position of Division Director in the IEEE Computer Society.

endorsements.name: André Seznec
endorsements.title: Senior Director of Research
endorsements.organization: INRIA, France
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc has significantly contributed to advancing the state-of-the-art in the field of computer architecture, my own field of expertise. Through his whole career, he has served the community at every level. He has been the EECS department chair at UC Irvine from 2003 to 2009. He founded the multidisciplinary PACT conference in 1993. He has been the general chair or program chair of prominent computer architecture conferences including ISCA 1992, PACT 1995 and HPCA 2001. He has been the editor-in-chief of several IEEE journals including IEEE Transactions on Computers, and IEEE Computer Architecture Letters. His involvement in the IEEE Computer Society has been significant and he has served in many functions crucial to the IEEE community: he has chaired the IEEE TC on Computer Architecture for two terms, he has been on the board of governors for 2009-2018, he was an IEEE Computer Society vice President for 3 years (2013-2015) and then the President of the IEEE Computer Society in 2017. I know that Jean-Luc Gaudiot will be an outstanding IEEE Computer Society Division Director.

endorsements.name: Michel Cosnard
endorsements.title: INRIA Honorary Chairman, Professor
endorsements.organization: University of Nice - Sophia Antipolice, France
endorsements.quote: I have known Jean-Luc Gaudiot for 30 years. We have served in many committees and edited several conference proceedings. Jean-Luc is an outstanding researcher, a dedicated member of the computer science community and a truly international fellow. He has already made substantial contributions to the community through his work as President of the Computer Society in a wide range of activities. I strongly support him for Computer Society Division Director.

endorsements.name: Marios M. Polycarpou
endorsements.title: Professor, IEEE Fellow
endorsements.organization: University of Cyprus; Past-President IEEE Computational Intelligence Society (2014); Director KIOS Research Center for Intelligent Systems and Networks
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc Gaudiot's dedication to the advancement of the Computer Sciences is well known in the community. Jean-Luc will not be a stranger in the Computer Society, as he has been on the board of Governors since 2010. Jean-Luc's was the chair of EECS department at the University of Irvine from 2003-2009. His management skills and leadership qualities proven by the remarkable rise of his department in US News and World report rankings, CS from 48 to 22 and EE 46-36. I expect that the IEEE computer Society will also benefit greatly from Jean-Luc's leadership. Jean-Luc has a long history of service to the Computer Society as Editor in Chief of prestigious journals, the organization of many conferences and his four year as the Chair of the IEEE Technical Committee on Computer Architecture. Jean-Luc has been involved in all aspects of the Computer Sciences as a highly respected Professor with ties to the Industry and service to the IEEE Computer Society. I am sure he will be a terrific division director.

endorsements.name: Per Stenström
endorsements.title: Professor, IEEE Fellow
endorsements.organization: Chalmers University of Technology
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc's dedication to the field of computing systems and its vibrant community is outstanding. Through a large variety of leadership roles including program chairman, EiC of IEEE Transactions on Computers and co-founding EiC of IEEE Computer Architecture Letters, elected chair for IEEE Technical Committee of Computer Architecture over two terms and more recently as President of the IEEE Computer Society, I can think of no one better suited to the position as Division Director for the IEEE Computer Society. I have worked with Jean-Luc in various capacities over the past several years and always find in him a colleague who does the best for our community. I am very sure that Jean-Luc Gaudiot will be an excellent Division Director for the IEEE Computer Society.

endorsements.name: Mateo Valero
endorsements.title: Director
endorsements.organization: Barcelona Supercomputing Center
endorsements.quote: Doctor Gaudiot is a world class researcher with many important and influential results. His body of work is substantial and wide in focus, ranging from the exploration of programmability in parallel processing to the design and analysis of modern parallel architectures. I consider his research in Computer Systems Design and his service to the community outstanding. I have known him for many years and I must say that the number and quality of publication and his support of the community are the marks of a passionate researcher and personally I believe he is a very human and ethical person. He expertly led the Computer Society through difficult financial times in 2017 and I know he would be a strong advocate for the Computer Society as a Division Director

endorsements.name: Hironori Kasahara
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: Department of Computer Science & Engineering, Waseda University; Ex-Senior Executive Vice President, Tokyo, Japan
endorsements.quote: Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot is an internationally famous computer researcher who was the IEEE Computer Society President in 2017. I have been working with him for years for the Computer Society members and the evolution of computer education, research and development as President in 2018. In addition, we are working together as ACM/IEEE ISCA 2025@Tokyo General Co-Chairs. I strongly believe Jean-Luc's leadership and vision will give us innovation in computer research and education as the IEEE Division V Director. I am pleased to endorse his candidacy for the vital position of Computer Society Division Director.

endorsements.name: Kemal Ebcioglu
endorsements.title: President
endorsements.organization: Global Supercomputing Corporation
endorsements.quote: I have known Prof. Jean-Luc Gaudiot since 1987. Prof. Gaudiot and I were among the original co-founders of the Parallel Architectures and Compilation Techniques (PACT) conference, which continues to be held to this day. Prof. Gaudiot is an outstanding pioneering computer architecture researcher, an outstanding educator and mentor, and an outstanding research leader, cognizant of the broad societal impact of research projects. I believe that Prof. Gaudiot's strategic technical vision and past experience as an IEEE Computer Society President make him a uniquely qualified candidate for the IEEE Computer Society Division V Director position. I fully endorse Prof. Gaudiot for the position of IEEE Computer Society Division V Director.

endorsements.name: Albert Y. Zomaya
endorsements.title: Peter Nicol Russell Chair Professor of Computer Science
endorsements.organization: University of Sydney, Australia
endorsements.quote: I have known Jean-Luc for many years and have closely followed his extraordinary career. I find him to be a luminary in Computer Architecture and Parallel Processing, fields in which he is highly recognized for having published many impressive results. I have observed him at many meetings where he has delivered powerful presentations and saw how he inspired our colleagues, from junior graduate students to seasoned professionals. He is truly an exceptional researcher with a long-ranging vision and an enviable record of achievements. His service to the professional community is equally remarkable: he has organized many conferences, chaired the technical program committees of the most prestigious meetings in our field, and even initiated a whole new symposium, which has since become a "must attend" in our domain. I worked with him on other projects when he was Editor-In-Chief of the IEEE Transactions on Computers, giving me further admiration for his organization and clear thinking. This did pay off as he was elected to the Computer Society Board of Governors and then as its 2017 President. I understand that his tenure was an unmitigated success that cemented the financial recovery of the Computer Society. All these elements give me full confidence that he will excel in the position of IEEE Computer Society Division Director and I urge you to vote for him.

endorsements.name: Zhiwei Xu
endorsements.title: Chair Professor
endorsements.organization: Great Bay University, China
endorsements.quote: I have known Professor Jean-Luc Gaudiot for nearly 40 years, since I was a PhD student at USC. We worked together as IEEE volunteers in various capacities, including strengthening cooperation between IEEE-CS and CCF, when he was president of IEEE Computer Society and I chaired the Policy Committee of China Computer Federation. I am always impressed with his professionalism and global perspective. In particular, in his long-time services to IEEE members, Professor Gaudiot has shown unique leadership and adaptivity in handling difficult problems during our changing time. He has my most enthusiastic endorsement for IEEE Division Director.

endorsements.name: Keqiu Li
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: School of Computer Science and Technology, Tianjin University, China
endorsements.quote: I worked with Prof. Gaudiot in my role as one of the members of the TPDS EIC Search Committee and he was the chair. From this event, I could see his deep love of the IEEE Computer Society. Prof. Gaudiot is a remarkable academic model, which can be seen from his knowledge, visionary and thought-provoking thinking, prompt reaction, etc. Furthermore, Prof. Gaudiot has contributed much to the IEEE Computer Society and know well about this society. I have no doubt that Professor Gaudiot will be an outstanding representative of the Computer Society as a Division Director.

endorsements.name: R. Govindarajan
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: Department of Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc has served in many high impact positions at the Computer Society, including as President of the IEEE Computer Society and Chair for IEEE Technical Committee of Computer Architecture for two terms. His tenure as President of the Computer Society was quite successful, leading us to a better financial situation, new products and improved links with India and other developing counties. During his tenure as Chair of IEEE Technical Committee of Computer Architecture, he founded have IEEE Computer Architecture Letters, which has now become a major publication of the Computer Society. Earlier he has served as conference organizer, Program Committee chair, Editor-in-Chief of flagship titles in the Computer Society portfolio of publications. His contributions to the community is unparalleled. He has been clearly a successful and effective leader with a powerful long range vision. I cannot think of a colleague who is more qualified to lead Division V.

endorsements.name: David Abramson
endorsements.title: Professor Emeritus
endorsements.organization: School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, The University of Queensland, Australia
endorsements.quote: I have known Professor Gaudiot for nearly 30 years both professionally and personally. His expertise in parallel computing is well known and he has made major contributions to the field over a long period. He also makes substantial contributions to the professional activities of the IEEE through various committees, boards and journal editorships. On a personal level, Jean-Luc is hard working and operates at the highest ethical standard. For all these reasons he is very well placed to serve as IEEE Computer Society Division Director and i recommend his wholeheartedly.

endorsements.name: André Ivanov
endorsements.title: Ph.D., P.Eng., FIEEE, FEIC, FCAE
endorsements.organization: Professor and Head, Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of British Columbia, Vancouver
endorsements.quote: JL Gaudiot is a fitting and prime candidate for the role of IEEE Computer Society Division V Director. JL Gaudiot brings a uniquely outstanding mix for the role. He is an accomplished academic, well recognized for his many teaching, research and administrative/leadership contributions. He also has a long demonstrated record of passionate and dedicated volunteer contributions, in particular for the IEEE and the IEEE Computer Society. In his former roles he has shown to be generous and considerate of different values and perspectives. JL Gaudiot not only brings an academic perspective, from his past experiences, he is readily capable of bringing the industry perspective and understanding. Towards reaching the IEEE goals, he will bring people skills to the mix of his competencies and experiences. I cannot think of a better candidate for the role of Division V Director than JL Gaudiot. I enthusiastically endorse his candidacy!

endorsements.name: François Coallier
endorsements.title: Professor
endorsements.organization: Concordia University, Montreal
endorsements.quote: Jean-Luc has been a very active contributor to our community for many years. His achievements, in both the academic realm and as an IEEE volunteer, make him a prime candidate for the leadership of the IEEE Computer Society. It is thus without hesitation that I am endorsing him as IEEE Computer Society Division V Director.
